name: Crystal Anthurium
description: Anthurium crystallinum 'Silver Blush' is a variegated form of Anthurium crystallinum, an epiphytic plant native to tropical regions of Colombia and Peru. It belongs to the Araceae family and features upright stems (30-60 cm tall) with large, dramatic, heart-shaped, velvety, dark green leaves with prominent white or silver veins that create stunning contrast, with additional silver variegation in the 'Silver Blush' form. The plant displays an upright, bushy growth habit. Many species have velvety leaves with prominent white or silver veins that create stunning contrast, and some produce fragrant blooms. In tropical forests, this plant typically grows as an epiphyte on tree trunks, receiving filtered sunlight through the dense canopy. In its native habitat, it grows on tree branches in tropical forests. In terrariums or indoor settings, this plant adds natural beauty with its distinctive velvety foliage. It's extremely popular among Anthurium enthusiasts for its unique leaf texture and variegation.
careTips: Keep soil consistently moist but well-draining
Toxic if ingested - keep away from pets and children
Bright indirect light for best flowering
